data.title: 2024 Primetime TV Schedule: ABC, CBS and More Announce Lineups
data.meta_description: ABC, CBS and more networks unveiled their 2024 primetime TV schedule after the WGA and SAG-AFTRA strikes came to an end
data.text:
After having to postpone their traditional fall primetime TV lineups in 2023 due to the WGA and SAG-AFTRA strikes, networks promised an even bigger 2024.

The Writers Guild of America (WGA) strike ended in September 2023 after nearly five months, while the Screen Actors Guild-American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (SAG-AFTRA) came to a tentative agreement with the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers (AMPTP) that November.

In the wake of the strikes’ conclusion, ABC and CBS announced in early November 2023 that their 2024 TV schedules are packed with beloved series, including Grey’s Anatomy’s 20th season and the return of NCIS for season 21 and NCIS: Hawai’i for season 3.

CBS pushed Kathy Bates’ new Matlock revival and Damon Wayans‘ Poppa’s House to the 2024-2025 TV season.

ABC, meanwhile, acquired Fox’s 9-1-1 in May 2023. The police drama will make its new network debut on Thursday, March 14.

Scroll down to see what network shows are returning in the new year as part of the Primetime 2024 lineup:

ABC

Monday, January 22

The Bachelor: 8 p.m. (season 28, two-hour premiere)

20/20 true crime edition: 10 p.m. (title TBA)
